1562000931_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
>We'll write our own ZeroNet implementation, for other platforms, in another language. Completely independent of what the current ZeroNet looks like

I think that's the best approach, it's a good way to show what you want to do with ZeroNet and show competence.

1561824300_1CNe5dawwwFVVvafLRWL184gQSySU.body:
> [xcape2net](#comment_78_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): I'm interested in being able to use PHP.  I never learned java, because I never agreed with the idea of websites running their code on users computers.  Having the ability to run PHP on ZeroNet zites would be very useful to me.

Users will still have to run code on their computers, albeit Python or PHP.
